result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Notice of Motion and Motion to Join (Cases 14CF392, 14CF428, 14CF495)

Defendant Brom M. Costa in court with attorney Emily I. Lonergan.  Valerian A. Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for December 17, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Brom M. Costa in court with attorney Emily I. Lonergan.  Diane M. Donohoo with Tracy McMiller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

TOTAL BOND COVERS 14CF392 AND 14GF846 (14-4104)
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH J. G. OR HER RESIDENCE. "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party.If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Brom M. Costa in court, in custody with attorney Emily I. Lonergan.  Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for October 8, 2014 at 01:15 pm.  Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing scheduled for December 10, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
Exhibit stored in file.
Not guilty plea and trial reserved.  Matter set over for STC. Parties notified that any motions must be filed prior to the Status Hearing.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

Defendant Brom M. Costa in court with attorney Emily I. Lonergan.  Cody John Horlacher appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court in session @ 3:02 pm. State calls Deputy Jeremy Renz who is duly sworn and responds to direct exam of ADA Horlacher. Exhibit S-1 marked and identified (copy of criminal complaint). Witness testifies as to Exhibit S-1. State moves for admission of exhibit. Objection by Attorney Lonergan as to admission. Objection noted for the record and Exhibit is admitted into evidence.
3:05 pm - Cross exam by Attorney Lonergan.
3:14 pm - Redirect by ADA Horlacher
3:15 pm - Recross by Attorney Lonergan
State rests - no further evidence. No witnesses or evidence for the Defense. Evidence is closed.
3:17 pm - Argument by Attorney Lonergan
3:18 pm - Argument by ADA Horlacher
3:19 pm - Court finds probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. Information filed - reading waived. 
Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for December 10, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Signed bond filed with the court.
Notice to Person Posting Bond Money
Signed bond filed with the court.

**2nd AMENDMENT 09-05-2014: IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the no contact with J.G. is lifted and modified to NO VIOLENT CONTACT. "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party.

**AMENDED ON 08-29-2014 TO INCLUDE:   If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party. VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH J.G. OR HER RESIDENCE.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant. (E: 14-3654, 14-3655, 14-3656)
